meanings.definition: The act of crucifying or the state of being crucified.
meanings.sent1: The crucifixion of the criminal was a brutal punishment.
meanings.sent2: The historical records mention the crucifixion of many individuals.
meanings.sent3: The play had a comical scene where a character narrowly avoided crucifixion.
meanings.sent4: The artist depicted the crucifixion of the hero in a powerful painting.
meanings.sent5: The vivid description of the crucifixion left a lasting impression on the audience.

meanings.definition: The execution of a person by nailing or binding them to a cross.
meanings.sent1: The crucifixion of Jesus is a well-known event in Christian history.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers carried out the crucifixion of the condemned criminal.
meanings.sent3: In the movie, the superhero narrowly escaped a crucifixion by the villain.
meanings.sent4: The author used the crucifixion as a metaphor for sacrifice in the story.
meanings.sent5: The graphic novel depicted the crucifixion scene with vivid detail.
